item.title: Bryer.org
item.description: R Packages and Resources by Jason Bryer, Ph.D.

Biography Dr. Jason Bryer is currently an Assistant Professor and Associate Director in the Data Science and Information Systems department at the City University of New York. He is currently the Principal Investigator of the FIPSE ($3 million #P116F150077) and IES funded ($3.8 million R305A210269) Diagnostic Assessment and Achievement of College Skills (DAACS), which is a suite of technological and social supports designed to optimize student learning. Dr. Bryerâ€™s other research interests include quasi-experimental designs with an emphasis on propensity score analysis, data systems to support formative assessment, and the use of open source software for conducting reproducible research.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I am currently teaching the following course at the City University of New York (CUNY) in the Master of Science in Data Science program: DATA606 Statistics and Probability for Data Analytics R Package to support DATA606 is available here: https://github.com/jbryer/DATA606
